call_title: Ergoversary Special - Weekly Update & AMA - July 1st

topics.title: Ergo 6th Anniversary Celebration
topics.summary: Team celebrates Ergo's 6th anniversary, comparing the blockchain's maturity to Bitcoin at 6 years old in 2015. kushti notes Ergo has less technical issues than Bitcoin had at the same age, particularly with multi-sig support.

topics.title: Node Release Update and Ethereum Dependencies
topics.summary: Armeanio discusses preparing a node release, updating packages and testing. Release was delayed due to resolving dependencies related to Ethereum's latest hard fork.

topics.title: Sub-blocks DevNet Testing Progress
topics.summary: kushti reports successful sub-blocks DevNet testing with load testing completed. Plans to integrate sub-blocks support into public testnets between July 15-25th for version 6.0, along with upcoming emission reduction voting.

topics.title: Early Ergo History and Team Origins
topics.summary: Dan Friedman and kushti share memories of Ergo's early development starting in 2016 at IOHK. Discussion includes first meetings in Malta 2017 and the transition from research to business development phases.

topics.title: Ergo Development Roadmap and Layer 2 Plans
topics.summary: Armeanio outlines Ergo's evolution from ErgoMixer privacy features through native assets, DEXes, and current tooling improvements. kushti announces that merge-mined sidechains development has begun with coding and design specs in progress.

topics.title: Node Version Adoption and Network Stats
topics.summary: Discussion of impressive adoption rates for new node versions, with 30 nodes already running version 6.1 shortly after release. kushti attributes uptake to mining community outreach and oracle pool operator groups.

topics.title: Community-Run Explorer Infrastructure Project
topics.summary: qx() announces a decentralized explorer infrastructure project with load-balanced community-run nodes replacing Ergo Foundation hosted services. Plans include geographic distribution and hosting additional frontends like Sigma space.

topics.title: MCP AI Integration and Smart Contract Development
topics.summary: Mark demonstrates AI integration with Ergo through MCP (Model Context Protocol), including AI agents that can write smart contracts. Discussion covers potential for autonomous AI economies where agents perform tasks and pay each other.

topics.title: October Ergo Meetup Planning
topics.summary: Planning discussion for October 11th Ergo meetup including presentations on gluon gold, workshop activities, and community gathering logistics. Emphasis on grassroots networking versus expensive conference alternatives.

topics.title: Educational Blockchain Applications Development
topics.summary: qx() describes developing blockchain-based educational tools including attendance tracking and voting systems to replace expensive proprietary solutions like iClicker. kushti suggests using stealth addresses for anonymous voting implementations.
